Master Answer:
Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis, Hepatitis B, Polio and Haemophilus influenzae type b (DTaP-HB-IPV-Hib) vaccine is given as a series of 3 doses to infants at 2, 4 and 6 months of age. Contraindications to this vaccine include a history of anaphylactic (life threatening) reaction to a previous dose or to any of its components or a history of Guillain-BarrÃ© syndrome (GBS) within 8 weeks of receipt of a tetanus-containing vaccine.
Discuss your son's neurologial condition with your immunizing health care provider. Your son may be eligible for additional vaccines in the BC immunization schedule.
Immunization Nurse
